se.cbb.jprime.misc

Class DoubleKeyMap<V>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<K,V>
        • java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Long,V>
          • se.cbb.jprime.misc.DoubleKeyMap<V>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - value type.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.util.Map<java.lang.Long,V>

    public class DoubleKeyMap<V>
extends java.util.LinkedHashMap<java.lang.Long,V>
    Extends a linked hash map for long keys by allowing double keys to be converted to long keys. For double keys, key k' will return the value of stored key k if abs(k'-k) < eps, where eps is in the order of 5e-8. The map is suitable for caching purposes, since the elements are kept in access-order, and the map has a maximum size.

    Note: 1) Small double keys k such that abs(k) < eps may be disallowed for safety reasons (if it is undesirable that small keys k and k' should in fact both hash to the same element).

    Author:
    Joel Sj√∂strand.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DoubleKeyMap

        public DoubleKeyMap(int initialCapacity,
            int maxEntries,
            boolean disallowEpsKeys)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        initialCapacity - initial capacity.
        maxEntries - maximum number of simultaneous entries that are stored. The least recently accessed object is removed for this threshold not to be exceeded.
        disallowEpsKeys - if true, will refuse to insert an element on put(key,val) if abs(key) is very small. No exception will be thrown, however.
